pageContext.claim: “But with that being said, we're down over 40% border crossings. We've been able to do what I think nobody else has been able to do. We're down over 40% tonight, where I'll be discussing joint efforts to stop illegal immigration and secure the borders.”
pageContext.analysis: The department defines “illegal inflows” as the people who make it into the United States. DHS estimates this figure, using “the odds of successful entry multiplied by apprehensions” as its formula. That number rose 42 percent in February, 206 percent in March and 244 percent in April. Setting that aside, many experts argue that this metric doesn't accurately define how many people are trying to enter the U.S., rather it is a measure of the success of the border patrol.
